title: Mothers tune in to CBeebies for Tom Hardy's return
text: Share this article Share CBeebies was also seen trending on Twitter as parents shared their excitement for the actor's return to the children's channel. Mothers have been left in a state of excitement after Tom Hardy returned to CBeebies for a Valentine's edition of Bedtime Stories Tom appeared on the toddlers TV channel reading The Cloudspotter by Tom McLaughlin Before his segment even aired the trailer received over four million views and CBeebies was trending on Twitter And following his story telling tonight the 39-year-old actor was met with even more tweets from appreciative fans. Many parents were left hot under collar after taking Tom's words as a personal message to them. After he finishes reading the story, Tom addresses the viewer to say 'I've spotted that you're not in bed yet. Quick go on. 'Get yourself tucked up and I'll see you very soon for another bedtime story until then night night'. Several parents admitted to cancelling their Valentine's plans in order to catch the show - leaving some dads a little ticked off that their efforts had been overshadowed. Several women admitted that they didn't even have the excuse of being a mother and were watching the show intended for toddlers alone. Several women admitted to enduring an episode of In The Night Garden before hand as they prepared for Tom's big moment. The hunky Peaky Blinders actor, 39, from London, will read The Cloudspotter by Tom McLaughlin. Tom tells the story of Franklin, a little boy who spends his time all by himself spotting not just clouds but adventures in the sky. This way, he doesn't feel so alone. When Scruffy Dog comes along, things begin to change for Franklin. How can he concentrate on cloudspotting when Scruffy is such a distraction? Could it be that two cloudspotters are better than one? The Hollywood megastar allegedly suffered the major loss after Taboo, pictured as James Delaney, drew in £8.4million - which has not matched the £10.4million the show racked up to make Tom was joined by his own dog, Woody, to tell this story, which celebrates the power of the imagination and the importance of friendship. When Tom read stories on CBeebies on December 31 mothers sent the internet into meltdown with excitement. When the news was shared on the channel's Facebook page, mothers took to the comments section in their droves to share their excitement. Tom is happily married and has a child with actress Charlotte Riley One mother received over 600 likes for her comment about the Mad Max star: 'Three long years of upsy daisy and igle pigle...this is the best news i have had !... what should i wear ?...how long do we have ?...the child will have to be very quiet at this story time....its a special one...' Tom joins a long list of famous faces who have read for children. Past celebrities include Damian Lewis, Nadiya Hussain and David Hasselhoff. Read more: Share or comment on this article 241
